alert.note: Alert for Northeast Mountains (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 01 at 2:44PM PST until March 02 at 12:00PM PST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM TO NOON PST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches. * WHERE...Sandpoint, Orin-Rice Road, Ione, Metaline, Metaline Falls, Eastport, Newport, Springdale-Hunters Road, Deer Park, Schweitzer Mountain Road, Fruitland, Priest River, Bonners Ferry, Athol, Flowery Trail Road, Colville, Kettle Falls, Clark Fork, Northport, Chewelah, and Tiger. * WHEN...From 4 AM to Noon PST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Motorists should be prepared for winter driving conditions during the Thursday morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The most significant travel impacts are expected in the morning on Thursday. Snow and graupel showers will continue into the afternoon, but temperatures warming into the 30s will decrease snow accumulation efficiency.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
